title: Something annoying about the new keystones
body: Everyone that is obviously meant for AP champs like perxie can be used by ad champions. While ap champs only have the ones that are meant for them. The attack speed one will be useless on ap champs just an example

replies.body:
The balancing with the new rune system will be hell anyways.

Most champions that rely on Thunderlords now will lose much power, if there is no substitute for it.

But pre season kicks in in november, so there is still 5 - 5 and a half months time for everything to change, so there is no need for premature conclusions

> [{quoted}](name=TaliyahToMaster,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=6KH6RfUn,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2017-06-02T00:40:09.531+0000)

I'm scared of the Essence Thief rune - that's ~200 extra health on squishies by midgame, which is honestly scary.

I'm most worried about Gangplank though, he's gonna get ~400 health for powerfarming if the game goes on long enough, he won't even need to worry about defensive items, and if he does get one he'll be tanky as fuck.

Essence Thief can be meaningful certainly, HP/level runes can be a good rough comparison though. They're good choices on some champs, you're giving up other options to take them though so they're certainly not universally used. With Essence Thief you're also then having to commit to at least one other Rune in the Resolve tree, so there's some additional opportunity cost to consider.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=6KH6RfUn,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2017-06-02T02:01:21.547+0000)

With Essence Thief you're also then having to commit to at least one other Rune in the Resolve tree, so there's some additional opportunity cost to consider.

Sounds like they're a big buff to supports - both tanks and otherwise. Assuming the other trees are more offensive, or perhaps utility based, the tank stats would be very powerful on them.

Guess it's as you said, we'll need to see what the other runes are before gauging their strength.

Balance will likely take a while to get smoothed out yeah, hence the pre-season release (we originally considered a mid-season date, but amongst other things amount of gameplay disruption felt really high for that). 

In terms of champs currently depending on specific masteries or runes to function properly we'll be doing an extended pass on that to avoid leaving champs abandoned. Hoping we get most of those pre ship, will certainly adjust post ship if needed too though.
Oh good, this was one of my major concerns. Support Poppy/J4 are my favorite to play when they fit in my team's comp, but they're rely on the existing runes/masteries heavily to function.
Wonder if Riot can get Viktor to a sub 44% winrate again when TLD goes away.

Sounds good, we'll be sure to hit the Boards again with feedback after each set of releases :)

Perxie, like a number of other keystones, is intended to be accessible to champions scaling with AD or AP. It's got AP and AD scaling on both the damage and shield as a result. There will be some runes that require more specific playstyles, whether that's auto attacking a lot, having/using mana, affinities for particular item types or whatever. All champs should feel they've got access to some non universal perks though certainly, not just auto attackers.

Pretty sure its still a work in progress, give it some time before complaining

Conversation must be voiced early or they faced being ignored or not brought up again. 

If the reworked runes are anything like the last few class updates were in for a _rough_ time.

AD champs include casters AND rightclickers where AP champs are primarily casters 

It's not really hard to see why this is the case, even if it is fairly annoying
